author: Joe Schmidt
comment: Stopped working months ago using Note4 on Nexus Player.  Nexus Player OTA update to Android 'O' and still not working... Connects then back to connect to device screen with no error message.  Lots of people reporting this so if yours works then good for you. Only needed when I typing on certain apps. I have an idea this will never be fixed.  I love my Nexus Player, guess it will be relegated to an older TV when I get Nvidia shield TV.

author: Emmanuel Beltran
comment: It hardly keeps a stable connection between a Samsung S7 Edge and an Nvidia Shield TV 2017 through Bluetooth. If I leave the phone locked, I have to either restart this app or turn the Bluetooth on and off. The keyboard typing also lags between the phone and the Shield. It would be easier to set up a connection if we could manually input the IP address of the device we want to connect with this app.

author: Robert Ungureanu
comment: Well, awesome! So now I can change the input and scroll around the menu of my tv via bluetooth? Great! Touchpad works perfectly (S8, Bluetooth, ~2.5m away from tv). Only to realize I can't even control the volume since there's no option. Bummer. Semi-useless. And I have to give location access for it? Ok, ok, thanks Google, but I'll pass this one. Later.

author: Karthik MPS
comment: When I started using it with my Mi Box Android TV, it was super good. But after a few months it doesn't recognize my mi box anymore. It occasionally does and works but not most of the times.   The problem is not just on the Samsung j5 that used to work really well. Same with Huawei Honor Pro 8.   The app tries connecting to the Mi Box and it goes on forever.  Any help is much appreciated.

author: Daniel Koh
comment: It's a great convenience - if it stops trying to be too smart in input. The Android TV default keyboard does not work with hardware keyboards, and now this app fails to work with smarter software keyboards (like HTC's default TouchPal)... Stop doing "a Microsoft"! (i.e. good/great product, retards for UI/UX guys)

author: Wilfredo Nelson
comment: ....but it definitely needs to register touch a whole lot faster. All in all, a decent option if you can't find your Nexus Player remote, but it lacks the responsiveness to replace said remote. Update - App no longer works. Sees my devices (Shield TV & Nexus Player), but is no longer able to connect to them.

author: Tony Gaines
comment: I would love this app, but it does not recognize my mi box about 70% of the time and you have to reset the wifi for it to find it again. I thought maybe it was the mi box, but then I tried sure worked remote and it found my mi box instantly on my WiFi network. Come on Google. You literally could do better.

author: Avelino Alicea
comment: The keyboard function doesn't work. When you type on your phone it's supposed to allow you to hit enter and then sends your input to the TV, but it doesn't. It just sits there on what you typed and never gets sent. What's the point? At least re-enable the keyboard on the TV itself so we can use that as an alternative.

author: Andrei Lavrenov
comment: Look, it works but lacks key functionality like changing the volume or even shutting off the tv. I'll have to stick to my IR blaster remote (app) even though this one works much more reliable...

author: Truekingr6
comment: Its really amazing, its so simple, it has D-pad or a touch pad function, and the coolest thing is that i use ny phones volume buttons to control my tvs volume!!that blew me away! And there's hardly no latency, uts perfect with my sony XBR800D

author: Katia Barretto
comment: Works specifically for android tv which makes it convenient because that's all it does. No extra options to use for other devices. Clean and simple. There is a glitch though where sometimes the keyboard doesn't pop up but it's not often. Hope it gets fixed but otherwise still love it.

author: Ajay Zalavadia
comment: Needs more buttons , Atleast Next, Previous and  Stop. Move the home button out of the way to prevent exiting the current activity by accident. Adding a feature to be able to receive audio from Android TV to Android phone to simulate wireless headphones would be nice.

author: Aaron Johns
comment: If you are using a Tplink router, you would have issues with this app. If your router has an update, update the firmware on it. Tplink issued an update for certain routers to fix the connection problem with Android devices. This app started working well after I updated my router firmware. In case if it still doesn't work, try another router or factory reset the Android TV or enable Bluetooth on your mobile device.

author: James P352
comment: Microphone doesn't work. (Yes all permissions are on.) Keyboard button types but doesn't enter. WTH? Five stars if I finally get flawless voice search. Potential to make me so happy! And please add a power-off button.

author: S Lee
comment: Keyboard function doesn't work and Google TV remote won't allow you to type in manually anymore. Now I can't log in to a wifi network... What wrong with this picture? everything... Not too smart, Google...not too smart. Of course unless your intention is to kill off all functioning Nexus TVs from your consumers...

author: Dio Ortiz
comment: This app was rushed and is not useful. First problem it has is that it doesn't consistently connect to devices. Everyone in my family downloaded this to include iPhones. All of us have different phones and this is a paying to connect to the TV. Second biggest issue it has, it is to simplistic. It does not give you all the buttons you need to adequately control the TV. At a minimum there should have been the Discover button, input button, volume buttons and a settings button to get to the TV's settings. This app has a long way to go before becoming useful. Going to uninstall till it is vastly improved.

author: timothy brister
comment: Why do so many of you complain about the volume function? I have a Galaxy S7 and my phone's volume buttons control the volume just fine. How about testing everything out asking the question before leaving a negative review because you can't figure out how to use it. Use the WiFi function instead of bluetooth if you have issues with Bluetooth. I have been using this on my shield for several months without a single issue.  I understand the mouse function would be great but that is the only negative thing. Overall this remote is awesome!

author: Ryan Memmott
comment: So my POS Nexus player updated to 8.0 and I can't connect to a new WiFi network because the POS Nexus player is not smart enough to have a built in keyboard and says finish on mobile device to enter password. The problem is your POS Nexus remote app, much like your POS Nexus player doesn't work. I bring the keyboard up and type but nothing comes up in the screen. My phone is in Oreo like the POS Nexus player. Classic...  Update your POS app to work with the latest operating system. iOS is no longer supported either. My POS Nexus player is now useless because I can't type in a GD password.

author: PJ P
comment: Does not detected my Android S10 R-TV box. My mobile is connected with same WiFi network but also not working with Bluetooth option also. Totally waste app.

author: Stephen Plant
comment: 100% useless. I tried to use it to give me a keyboard entry for my Sony Android tv. Only thing you can enter is characters. No letter. And the touchpad is so bad it's laughable. I cannot believe Google released an app that is so unbelievably bad

author: PraveenKumar Valavan
comment: Paired a 3s prime with w800c tv, the rest of the functionalities work awesome but the keyboard is having issues. When I press space, the words that are typed disappear. Otherwise the app deserves 5stars. Please add volume controls.

author: Darlene Reyes
comment: I use with my old galaxy s5, iPhone 6 and galaxy note 3. Great as ONLY a remote for my nexus player since it does not turn on/off or control my volume ot options on my T.V.. I have peel remote installed as my Samsung T.V. remote. I would give it a higher rating but All 3 devices freeze when using the keyboard on the device to search on this app. I have to disable the app to restart which us time consuming.

author: David Kitchen
comment: My TV is cabled to LAN and allocated a different subnet than the WiFi, so this never connects. If I move the TV to WiFi then the HD Netflix forever buffers. Google really need to make a remote app worthy of a £1k TV.
title: Does not work

author: Reese Civiok
comment: Great app for when you loose your remote or it stops working. The only issue I have with this app is the timing out glitch where you have to reconnect the remote to the device every time your screen times out. Other than that over all great app!

author: neinname neinslogan
comment: not useful. keyboard does not sync properly, so that function is worthless. d-pad works ok, but why bother when i have more functionality with the tv's remote?

author: russell jones
comment: Oneplis 3 Phone  XBR700D Sony Tv Works Great But no option to change input sources.  Yeah i still give it a 5. "PS" using through Bluetooth" ----Edit No longer recognize my tv at all.

author: TonGi018
comment: The app works but the swipe pad is a pain to use in comparison to the d-pad and what's really missing is a gamepad mode that also utilizes the accelerometer for things like racing games. (We already know that there's a gamepad mode coming (thanks to an excellent APK teardown by AndroidPolice) so hurry up guys, please.)

author: Hrafn Þorvaldsson
comment: First ever Android TV just bought, and am suggested to use this app. As soon as I attempt to connect to the tv, or even just starting the app sometimes, it crashes. And this on a Pixel phone

author: Dan Lynch
comment: Persistent notification with no way to shut it down? Come on, Google. You wouldn't tolerate this stupidity from somebody else's app. A notification if I switch to another app is great. A notification that I can't get rid of, even if I force close the app, is pathetic.

author: Jonathon Colby Gable
comment: A simple and functional app that I find more convenient than the physical remote. Unfortunately it has not been able to connect over WiFi for well over 6 months. I've submitted feedback a few times now, although no fix has been supplied. Quite frustrating.

author: Rajender Mehta
comment: Great App from Google. Free alternative of costly remote for sony tv.  Issue: keyboard typing is buggy. The moment you press space, previous word goes away.

author: Julia Whitwell
comment: It's useless. I was hoping for something that would exploit the functions of my TV and the flexibility of a touch screen remote, but it is just dumbed down to a low-function D Pad (per screenshot).

author: Kevin Lopes
comment: The application does not work on either of my 3 cell phones, all different brands. The keyboard is laggy and does not input any text into my Sony x930c TV.

author: Daniel Ornelas
comment: Haven't been able to connect to my Nexus Player for WEEKS!! Inexcusable. On both my phone and tablet when I click to connect it refuses to connect.

author: Mr. Dillard
comment: The app is very responsive, and I dig the touchpad. Nice the way volume buttons auto switch to the TV when in the app and back to you phone controls when you leave.  Needs a minor refresh, perhaps a smooth widget with a volume slider. Or some slick icon shortcuts to things like mute and pause. A universal jump back 10 seconds and skip forward with functionality for all apps would be super handy. Also could really use a dedicated mute button on the interface.  Update the nav button icons with the times. No more silly house. This is your own app Google, give a damn.

author: Kevin Taylor
comment: The keyboard doesn't work well with my Android phone, or at all with my iPhone. Makes it difficult to navigate or type things in. Better off using the remote control that came with it .

author: Adam Bennett
comment: The idea of control thru the app is nice, but the app stays on & turns my TV on when I didn't ask for it. Better control & functionality tremendously needed. The permissions are ridiculous too!

author: Neil L
comment: Wow this sucks on a whole new level. PS the Samsung S8 is a laggy pile of junk don't buy it

author: Final Elixir
comment: The app for me states "searching" I'm a continuous loop giving me no error message or a connected message. Useless

author: Kenneth Bishop
comment: This application should work all the time time, but it doesn't. I've come back here a number of times to reinstall the application because it will not connect to my Nexus player and 2017 Shield TV. This has been going on for years. Don't mean to be rude but it's as if Google isn't listening or whoever's​ been delegated the responsibility to maintain this app simply doesn't care. Just look at the all negative reviews with  no feedback.
